properties.areaDesc: Marathon; Langlade; Lincoln; Forest; Wood; Oneida; Vilas
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 10:43PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
Light snow or flurries will continue at times into early Thursday
morning. Any additional accumulation should be less than an inch,
except for locally higher amounts across the snowbelt region of
northwest Vilas County.

The combination of new snow, or melting snow on pavement surfaces
from yesterday afternoon will continue to cause untreated roads,
bridges, parking lots and sidewalks to be snow or ice covered.
Gusty northerly winds may also create some areas of blowing and
drifting snow.

Temperatures around daybreak on Thursday are expected to fall
into the single digits below zero. The combination of the cold
temperatures and gusty northerly winds will produce wind chill
readings in the 15 below to 25 below zero range late tonight into
Thursday morning. Wind chill readings this low can produce frost
bite within 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving tonight, as roads
will be slippery due to ice or snow. If venturing outdoors, wear
layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to protect yourself
from the bitter cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS AND BITTER COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
